intro: Viola alba nothosubsp. bonaefidei, commonly known as the white violet, is a hybrid plant that exhibits characteristics of both its parent species. It is a herbaceous perennial with heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The botanical classification of this nothosubspecies highlights its role in plant hybridization studies and ecological diversity.
